definition: to count/to count as/to regard as/to enumerate (sb's shortcomings)
to die (when one's predestined life span is up)

sentences.english: And Sara lived a hundred and twenty-seven years.
sentences.chinese: 撒辣一生的寿数是一百二十岁。

sentences.english: Which of you by taking thought can add one cubit unto his stature?
sentences.chinese: 你们那一个能用思虑，使寿数多加一刻呢。

sentences.english: People say that all the years after 70 are gifts from the gods.
sentences.chinese: 人们说70岁之后的寿数是上天恩赐的。

sentences.english: And which of you with taking thought can add to his stature one cubit?
sentences.chinese: 你们那一个能用思虑，使寿数多加一刻呢。

sentences.english: I will add fifteen years to your life.
sentences.chinese: 我必加增你十五年的寿数。

definition: to die of old age/to live to a ripe old age/(fig.) (of sth) to come to an end (after a long period of service)
to die of old age/to die in one's bed at a ripe old age
skills acquired through religious practice/(fig.) ability/skill/Taiwan pr. [dao4 hang5]
one's days are numbered/not to have long to live (often fig.)
to have one's life shortened (by excesses etc)
to divulge the will of heaven (idiom); to leak a secret/to let the cat out of the bag
